result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven B Stillwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Probation may be transferred to the State of Georgia. Defendant NOT to travel outside the State of Georgia without agent's permission. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is imposed. No Contact with any co-defendants or any victims listed in the criminal complaint, including Devin Lofton. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Not to use or possess any checking related documents or bank checks unless received from HIS employer to him. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 100 days were granted.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

records.addlTxt: Dated 09/09/15, from the Court to the Defendant in response to letter received on 08/25/15. Request denied.
letter from Defendant requesting huber privileges
filed by the state

Defendant Steven B Stillwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeremy J Guza.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Special Agent Theresa Willliams makes statements.  Assistant Cheif Hennen makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Guza makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5  YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS      **Transfer allowed to State of Georgia**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Co-Defendant's or victims listed in criminal complaint-to include Devin Lofton
____Not to use or possess any checking related documents/bank checks (unless received from an employer to him)  
____Not to travel outside of the state of Georgia without agent's permission
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

CONDITION TIME:  6 Months jail straight time (100 days credit) to commence forthwith

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on August 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven B Stillwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeremy J Guza.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2-8 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Guza requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Court advises all parties of anticipated timeline for jury trial commencing on Monday, August 10, 2015.  Court orders counsels to submit proposed jury instructions to the court by 8/6/15 status date.  Court orders/requests all counsel to submit their proposed questions to jury panel by 8/6/15, as well as an approximate estimate of time on opening/closing statements.  Court states all exhibits should be marked before jury trial and requests parties to use projector/doc cam to show exhibits during trial.  Court reminds parties to provide street clothes for their clients for trial day (days).
